tachyon.security.authentication

Class AuthenticationUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • tachyon.security.authentication.AuthenticationUtils

  • public final class AuthenticationUtils
extends Object
    This class provides factory methods for authentication in Tachyon. Based on different authentication types specified in Tachyon configuration, it provides corresponding Thrift class for authenticated connection between Client and Server.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods

    • Method Detail

      • getServerTransportFactory

        public static org.apache.thrift.transport.TTransportFactory getServerTransportFactory(TachyonConf tachyonConf)
                                                                               throws SaslException
        For server side, this method returns a TTransportFactory based on the auth type. It is used as one argument to build a Thrift TServer. If the auth type is not supported or recognized, an UnsupportedOperationException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        tachyonConf - Tachyon Configuration
        Returns:
        a corresponding TTransportFactory
        Throws:
        SaslException - if building a TransportFactory fails

      • getClientTransport

        public static org.apache.thrift.transport.TTransport getClientTransport(TachyonConf tachyonConf,
                                                                        InetSocketAddress serverAddress)
                                                                 throws IOException
        Creates a transport per the connection options. Supported transport options are: AuthType.NOSASL, AuthType.SIMPLE, {link@ AuthType#CUSTOM}, AuthType.KERBEROS. With NOSASL as input, an unmodified TTransport is returned; with SIMPLE/CUSTOM as input, a PlainClientTransport is returned; KERBEROS is not supported currently. If the auth type is not supported or recognized, an UnsupportedOperationException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        tachyonConf - Tachyon Configuration
        serverAddress - the server address which clients will connect to
        Returns:
        a TTransport for client
        Throws:
        IOException - if building a TransportFactory fails or user login fails

      • createTSocket

        public static org.apache.thrift.transport.TSocket createTSocket(InetSocketAddress address,
                                                                int timeoutMs)
        Creates a new Thrift socket what will connect to the given address
        Parameters:
        address - The given address to connect
        timeoutMs - the timeout in milliseconds
        Returns:
        An unconnected socket
